titleInfo.title: Rank formulas for certain products of matrices

mods.abstract: For two matrix operations, called quasi-direct sum and quasi-outer product, we determine their deviations from multiplicative behaviour of the rank. The second operation arises in the determination of the function table for so-called sum-type functions such as the Hamming distance. A consequence of the corresponding rank formula is, that the frequently used log rank can be a very poor bound for two-way communication complexity. Instead, as was shown in [9], a certainexponential rank gives often excellent or even optimal bounds.

originInfo.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

titleInfo.title: Applicable Algebra in Engineering, Communication and Computing
